title: Halfway through The Open, Royal Portrush might be the only thing that can stop Scottie Scheffler
content: Over the second round, Scottie Scheffler did what he has done many times: made victory feel inevitable. But could this one be the toughest to hold on to?

title: Safely into weekend, Rory eyes big Open chase
content: Rory McIlroy carded a 2-under 69 in the second round of The Open to give him back-to-back under-par rounds.

title: Ionescu, fueled by loss to Curry, wins 3-point title
content: Sabrina Ionescu captured her second WNBA 3-point contest crown Friday night and called it redemption after losing to Stephen Curry in their 2024 shootout.

title: Acuña stuns Yanks with 301-foot outfield assist
content: Ronald Acuña Jr. caught the Yankees off-guard with a spectacular throw to end the third inning in the Braves' series-opening 7-3 victory Friday night.

title: Ex-NFLPA boss' strip club expenses face scrutiny
content: Former NFL Players Association leader Lloyd Howell Jr. resigned after an outside investigator hired by the union received documents this week showing he charged the union for two visits to strip clubs.

title: Scheffler cards 8 birdies, holds 1-shot Open lead
content: Scottie Scheffler made eight birdies on another wild afternoon of weather at Royal Portrush to build a one-shot lead at the Open Championship heading into the weekend.

title: Docs: Bettor placed 30 wagers on Rozier unders
content: A professional bettor placed 30 wagers in 46 minutes, all involving Terry Rozier in a 2023 NBA game, according to documents obtained by ESPN that reveal new details about the suspicious betting under scrutiny by federal investigators.

title: Police: Noose found at Titans' new stadium site
content: A noose was found at the site of the Titans' new Nissan Stadium, according to the Metropolitan Nashville Police Department, with work stopped at the site amid an investigation.

title: Attorney: Lawsuit alleging rape by Sharpe settled
content: A lawyer says NFL Hall of Fame member Shannon Sharpe has resolved a lawsuit that accused him of sexually assaulting a woman during their relationship.

title: Crowe gives Tigers highest-rated recruit since MPJ
content: Jason Crowe Jr., considered the No. 1 point guard in the 2026 class, announced his commitment to Missouri on Friday, becoming the Tigers' highest-ranked recruit in almost a decade.

title: ❤️ Paige Bueckers calls Azzi Fudd her girlfriend
content: The Dallas Wings rookie referred to the UConn Huskies guard as her girlfriend during WNBA All-Star Weekend.

title: WNBA All-Star grades: Liberty's Ionescu, Cloud sweep 3-point, skills challenge crowns
content: Natasha Cloud won the WNBA All-Star skills challenge. Sabrina Ionescu won the 3-point contest. We grade every competitor.

title: Five overreactions before 2025 NFL season: Commanders win NFC East? Chiefs lose AFC West?
content: Is the Bucs QB destined for a massive new contract? Will the Commanders own the NFC East? We're judging offseason overreactions.

title: Big Ten preview: Can Penn State finally break through? Will Ohio State repeat?
content: As the Big Ten looks to produce its third straight national champion, Bill Connelly breaks down all 18 teams.

title: It's time for the second half! Preview, rankings, playoff odds for all 30 MLB teams
content: Who will rule the rest of the season? Here's everything you need to know coming out of the All-Star break.

title: NBA summer league standouts: Flagg, Harper, Hansen and surprise stars
content: From Cooper Flagg to veteran players, Kevin Pelton hands out superlatives for 2025 NBA summer league.

title: The USMNT's to-do list before the 2026 World Cup, ranked by urgency
content: The USMNT's failure at the Gold Cup makes it clear changes are needed before the 2026 World Cup. Here are the five keys, ranked by urgency.

title: Weah to Marseille, Reyna to anywhere but Dortmund? Best transfer fits for USMNT stars
content: What moves, if any, should these eight USMNT players make to ensure they'll be in top form next summer?

title: Timeline: Caitlin Clark's injury-riddled first half of the WNBA season
content: Three separate injuries have sidelined the Indiana point guard and All-Star for 10 regular-season WNBA games.

title: 14 players who could be picked No. 1 in the 2026 NFL draft
content: Which quarterback could go first overall? What about edge rusher T.J. Parker or another non-QB? Let's project the race.

title: 'We couldn't chance it': Why the Suns and Bradley Beal finally came to terms
content: One element of the Suns' roster failure has loomed: How to end their marriage to the three-time All-Star.

title: Spain win first Euros knockout game, but still have work to do after beating Swiss
content: Spain's Euro journey will continue after defeating hosts Switzerland, though they have little time to dwell on winning their first knockout game at this tournament. After all, there's more history to make.

title: AFC North intrigue: Will Ravens be first to three-peat? Will Rodgers snap Tomlin's playoff skid?
content: The AFC North is loaded with intrigue and talent, from Lamar Jackson to Joe Burrow and now Aaron Rodgers. Here's what to know.

title: Chiefs QB Patrick Mahomes ready to enter new era: Turning 30
content: Mahomes has won two MVPs and three Super Bowls in his 20s. He'll turn 30 as he starts his ninth NFL season.

title: Assembling the 2028 Olympic roster for U.S. flag football: Our 10-player roster -- and one go-to play
content: We picked nine NFL players -- and one college football star -- for the U.S. Olympic flag football roster for 2028. Who would make our team?

title: Ranking the top 25 college football recruits regardless of class
content: Why let rising seniors get all the glory? We break down the best prospects in the country, including underclassmen.

title: WNBA players, coaches voice frustration over how games are called
content: Players, coaches and fans say they want greater consistency regarding how games are refereed and the level of physicality allowed.

title: Sources: Man Utd, Brentford agree Mbeumo deal
content: Manchester United are set to complete the signing of Bryan Mbeumo after agreeing a deal in excess of £70 million ($94m) with Brentford, sources have told ESPN.

title: Spain reach semifinals despite missing 2 penalties
content: Spain overcame missing two penalties to beat hosts Switzerland 2-0 on Friday to reach the Women's Euro semifinals for just the second time.

title: Madueke joins Arsenal from rivals Chelsea
content: Arsenal have completed the signing of Noni Madueke from London rivals Chelsea, the clubs confirmed Friday.

title: Copa warm-up rules changed after Marta criticism
content: CONMEBOL said it has adjusted pre-match procedures at the Copa América Femenina, following criticism from Brazilian players and coaching staff.

title: Wrexham sign New Zealand's Cacace from Empoli
content: Wrexham continued preparations for their latest promotion push with the signing of New Zealand international defender Liberato Cacace from Empoli.

title: Zlatan sends Holmberg support after penalty miss
content: Zlatan Ibrahimovic offered some words of support to Smilla Holmberg after her miss in Thursday's penalty shootout ended Sweden's Euro 2025 campaign.

title: Swiss hail Euros as 'take-off' moment despite exit
content: Switzerland coach Pia Sundhage hopes their run to the quarterfinals of their home Women's Euro will be a take-off moment for women's football in the country.

title: Masche on Messi, All-Stars: 'Would prefer rest'
content: Inter Miami head coach Javier Mascherano said he would prefer that Lionel Messi and Jordi Alba not participate in the 2025 MLS All-Star Game, insisting players should be resting amid the ongoing regular season.

title: ⚽ England win weirdest-ever penalty shootout
content: England came back from a 2-0 deficit to take Sweden to penalties and seal their place in the Euro 2025 semifinals, but they did it by virtue of one of the strangest, and longest, penalty shootouts ever.

title: How Bo Jackson on a bicycle united Alabama after a record-breaking storm
content: The GOAT created a bike ride to help tornado-damaged Alabama. No one knew what it'd do -- or how it'd end.

title: How five-star prospects Jason Crowe, JaShawn Andrews﻿ fit at Mizzou, Arkansas
content: Breaking down the fits of every top class of 2026 commitment, beginning with No. 4 Jason Crowe and No. 12 JJ Andrews﻿

title: Updated top 10 prospect rankings for all 30 MLB teams -- with 2025 draft picks included!
content: Who is rising and falling in every major league farm system after the MLB draft? Kiley McDaniel digs in.

title: 'Sad.' 'Embarrassing.' Why players were a no-show at the MLB draft
content: Moving the draft to All-Star week was supposed to give it some sizzle. But not one player was in attendance.

title: What it's like boxing Pacquiao, and how he can beat Barrios
content: Timothy Bradley Jr. shares his thoughts about fighting Manny Pacquiao and breaks down Saturday's fight.

title: Week 8 preview: Key stats, players for Indigenous Weekend
content: Fairfield, Connecticut, is the host for Friday's and Saturday's games. Here's the schedule, key stats, injury notes, more.

title: Teen Boy Sodomised, Forced Into Oral Sex On Indore School Campus
content: A 13-year-old boy was allegedly sodomised by two teenagers who forced him into oral sex on the campus of a school in Madhya Pradesh's Indore city, police said on Saturday.

title: "When I Asked People Bluntly...": Shashi Tharoor On US-Pak Cooperation
content: In the wake of the US' designation of The Resistance Front (TRF) as a Foreign Terrorist Organisation (FTO), Congress leader Shashi Tharoor has offered insight into the behind-the-scenes diplomatic exchanges that preceded the announcement.

title: Woman, Brother-In-Law Have An Affair, Kill Husband Using Sleeping Pills
content: The victim, Karan Dev, was brought to the Mata Rooprani Maggo Hospital on July 13 by his wife, Sushmita - who claimed that he had accidentally suffered an electric shock.

title: "Nice Shirt": US Border Patrol Mocks Arrested Migrant Wearing American Flag T-Shirt
content: An illegal immigrant was arrested by the Customs and Border Protection (CBP) on Friday in New York. But it wasn't just the arrest that caught attention.

title: "They Mentally Harassed Me": Noida College Student Kills Self, Blames Staff
content: A second-year Bachelor of Dental Surgery (BDS) student of a top private university in Greater Noida allegedly died by suicide in the women's hostel, alleging humiliation and mental harassment by two faculty members, police said on Saturday.

title: Actor Sangeeta Bijlani's Pune Farmhouse Vandalised, Items Stolen: Cops
content: Ms Bijlani said the main door and window grills were broken, a television set was missing, and several household items, including beds and a refrigerator, as well as CCTVs, were either damaged or vandalised.

title: Drugs, Steroids Found At Telangana Gym, Owner Arrested, Licence Cancelled
content: A gym owner in Telangana's Adilabad was arrested after illegal drugs and steroids were recovered from the fitness centre, the police said.

title: "Dubo-Dubo Ke Maarenge": Raj Thackeray Slams Nishikant Dubey, He Responds
content: BJP leader Nishikant Dubey, responding to Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray's "dubo-dubo ke maarenge" threat, with a question: "Did I teach Hindi to Raj Thackeray?"

title: TV Set, Rs 50,000 Stolen From Former Cricketer Azharuddin's Lonavala Bungalow
content: A case of burglary has been reported at the Lonavala bungalow owned by Sangeeta Bijlani, wife of former Indian cricketer Mohammad Azharuddin.

title: Congress Protest March In Srinagar Today Over J&K Statehood
content: After its letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, the Congress party is launching a campaign to put pressure on the central government to introduce a bill in the upcoming Parliament session for the restoration of statehood for Jammu and Kashmir.

title: "5 Jets Were Shot Down": Trump Makes Another Op Sindoor Claim
content: US President Donald Trump on Friday claimed that "five jets were shot down" in the recent conflict between India and Pakistan following the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: Greater Noida University Student Kills Self, Accuses Faculty Of Harassment In Note
content: A second-year Bachelor of Dental Surgery student of a Greater Noida University student allegedly died by suicide late Friday night in the girls' hostel located at the university campus, police said on Saturday.

title: Probe Agency ED Files Chargesheet Against Congress Leader, Wife In Land Deal Case
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Friday said it has filed a chargesheet against former Uttarakhand minister and Congress leader Harak Singh Rawat, his wife Deepti Rawat and others in a money laundering case.

title: On Camera, Gujarat Cop's Son Kills 2 With SUV During Race With Friend
content: The incident was captured on CCTV, which showed a speeding white Creta car hitting the two pedestrians and then ramming into a scooter.

title: Video: Man Swept Away In Floodwater In Rajasthan, Rescued By Hotel Staff
content: A hotel employees quick action saved a pilgrim from being swept away by floodwaters near Ajmer Dargah after heavy rain caused severe waterlogging in the area.

title: Schoolgirl Hacked To Death In Broad Daylight In Meghalaya
content: A schoolgirl was allegedly hacked to death in broad daylight at a village in Meghalaya's East Garo Hills district, police said on Saturday.

title: "It Is Time Meta Establishes Responsible Translation System": Siddaramaiah
content: Raising concerns over automatic translation on Facebook, Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah stated that poor translations have been a cause of miscommunication and public backlash, urging that the issue be taken seriously.

title: US Tech Company Launches Probe Into CEO, Head HR's Viral Coldplay Video
content: Astronomer Chief Executive Officer (CEO) Andy Byron has been sent on leave and co-founder and Chief Product Officer Pete DeJoy has been appointed as an interim, the company announced on Saturday.

title: Trump Sues WSJ Over Epstein Report, Seeks $10 Billion, Newspaper Responds
content: US President Donald Trump sued Dow Jones, News Corp, two Wall Street Journal reporters and the newspaper's owner Rupert Murdoch on Friday for libel and slander.

title: Bank Manager Dies By Suicide In Pune, Note Blames Work Pressure
content: A senior official of a nationalised bank allegedly committed suicide in Baramati in Maharashtra's Pune district, with a note recovered from the spot citing work pressure, police said on Friday.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Xavi Simons eyes Chelsea over Bayern, Barça
content: RB Leipzig attacking midfielder Xavi Simons wants a switch to the Premier League. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Waiver wire: Start the second half strong with these pickups
content: As the season's second half gets ready to begin, here are the players you should claim off the waiver wire.

title: 'Rudy' or 'Hoosiers'? Indiana fan poll highlights SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 4 quiz
content: "SportsCenter" is continuing its journey across America -- and we're continuing to test your state-specific sports knowledge with our Week 4 quiz.

title: Another scare: Air India Express flight from Hyderabad to Phuket makes U-turn mid-air
content: An Air India Express flight to Phuket returned to Hyderabad shortly after takeoff due to undisclosed reasons, adding to a series of recent technical issues across airlines. Earlier in the week, an IndiGo flight to Imphal also returned to Delhi due to a technical snag, undergoing checks before resuming its journey.

title: Patna hospital murder: 5 arrested in Kolkata over deadly shooting
content: In a joint operation, Patna Police and West Bengal STF apprehended five individuals in New Town, near Kolkata, concerning the murder of gangster Chandan Mishra. Mishra, a convicted murderer from Buxar, Bihar, was shot dead inside a Patna private hospital on Thursday while out on parole.

title: Exclusive | 'All good things come to an end': Williamson on Kohli's retirement
content: Kane Williamson, in an exclusive interview, lauded Shubman Gill's captaincy, stating it was no surprise given Gill's leadership qualities. Williamson highlighted Gill's world-class talent across formats and his impressive adaptation to challenging Test conditions. He also reflected on Virat Kohli's Test retirement, emphasising the bond shared beyond the field.

title: Sharda University student dies by suicide; 2 faculty members named in note
content: A tragic incident occurred at Sharda University. A second-year student ended her life in the hostel. She left a suicide note alleging harassment by two faculty members. Police arrested the accused teachers, Mahinder Sir and Shairq Maam. The student's family and other students expressed anger. Authorities are investigating the matter. The police are trying to maintain peace on campus.

title: Google Android head Sameer Samat to engineers: Beyond the degree, you should have…
content: Google's Android head, Sameer Samat, advises aspiring engineers that a computer science degree isn't enough to secure top tech jobs. He stresses the importance of developing deep expertise in areas of genuine passion beyond formal education. Samat believes computer science should focus on problem-solving, system design, and collaboration, not just coding, as AI increasingly automates basic programming tasks.

title: Chicken or fish? Tea or coffee? What do cricketers eat and drink during breaks
content: England's Ollie Pope revealed Test cricketers' varied diets during breaks, telling that while those not batting might feast on chicken, fish, or steak with pasta, he prefers a protein shake and banana when at the crease. Pope also shared that the 'Tea break' isn't always about tea, often opting for coffee instead.

title: 'Attempting to draw conclusions': FIP sends legal notice to Reuters, WSJ over AI171 crash reports
content: The Federation of Indian Pilots (FIP) has taken legal action against Reuters and The Wall Street Journal over their coverage of the Air India Flight 171 crash in Ahmedabad. FIP demands a public apology for what it deems "selective and unverified reporting," urging the outlets to cease speculative content and await the official AAIB report.

title: 'Jets were shot down': Trump again brings up India-Pakistan conflict
content: Donald Trump claimed he averted a major India-Pakistan conflict, stating the nuclear-armed nations were engaged in intense fighting with jets being shot down. He asserted his administration used trade negotiations to de-escalate the situation, linking trade deals to peaceful resolution.

title: Perplexity CEO says Google ‘a giant bureaucratic organization’
content: Perplexity's CEO, Aravind Srinivas, challenges Google's reliance on ads. He believes it hinders AI integration. Srinivas anticipates Google will adopt features from Perplexity's Comet browser. He also criticizes Google's organizational structure. Comet, an AI-powered browser, prioritizes users. It is currently available to premium Perplexity subscribers. A free version is planned. Srinivas aims to challenge Google's market dominance.

title: 'Investigations of this magnitude take time': US agency slams Air India 171 crash coverage
content: The NTSB criticized media coverage of the Air India Flight 171 crash preliminary report as premature and speculative. This follows the AAIB's release of its initial findings, which cited engine failure and cockpit confusion after takeoff from Ahmedabad. The AAIB urged against spreading unverified information and emphasized that the report only outlines events, not causes, pending a final, comprehensive analysis.

title: Russia oil sanctions: EU moves to hit Reliance, Nayara; but India may still benefit
content: New EU sanctions on Russian oil pose challenges for Indian giants Nayara Energy and Reliance Industries, potentially restricting their access to European markets. Nayara faces operational difficulties and banking hurdles, while Reliance risks losing its lucrative diesel market.

title: Watch: Ajmer floods sweep away bikes, carts and even people
content: Rajasthan is grappling with severe flooding after heavy downpours, prompting red alerts in several districts. Ajmer's Khwaja Garib Nawaz Dargah witnessed intense flooding, while a school van was stranded in Rajsamand, with children rescued by locals. Ajmer's hospital was also flooded, and residents are urged to stay indoors.

title: Goldman Sachs' new plan to keep junior talent: Will introduce additional early
content: Goldman Sachs is launching a new program to retain junior bankers amid increasing competition from private equity firms. The initiative offers select analysts an accelerated path to the Asset & Wealth Management (AWM) division after two years in investment banking. This strategy aims to provide an 'early entry point' for those interested in buyside careers.

title: India-US trade deal: Fifth round of talks for BTA completed
content: India and the United States concluded the fifth round of BTA negotiations in Washington, aiming to finalize an interim trade deal before August 1 to address Trump-era tariffs. Discussions covered agriculture, automobiles, and SCOMET, with India resisting duty concessions on dairy.

title: ‘Came with toys, left with heartbreak’: Mystery surrounds Russian woman found in cave
content: Dror Goldstein, an Israeli musician, journeyed to India hoping to reunite with his daughters, who were discovered living in a cave with their mother, Nina Kutina. Despite his efforts and travel from Israel, Dror faces legal obstacles preventing him from seeing his children, now held in a Foreigners Detention Centre.

title: IND vs ENG: Dilemma for India! Should the team persist with Karun Nair?
content: Team India faces a dilemma with Karun Nair's form at No. 3 in the ongoing England Test series, as he struggles to convert starts into substantial scores. With Sai Sudharsan waiting in the wings, the team management, led by coach Gautam Gambhir, is contemplating a change for the crucial Old Trafford Test.

title: India cries foul as EU curbs on Russia hit Gujarat refinery
content: Nayara Energy's Gujarat refinery becomes the first in India to face Western sanctions as the EU tightens restrictions on Russian oil exports, aiming to cut off funding for Moscow's war efforts. India opposes unilateral sanctions and emphasizes energy security, while the measures could impact Nayara's operations, exports, and Rosneft's stake sale plans.

title: Retired army officer, wife killed by former tenants in Bikaner
content: In Bikaner, police have arrested three individuals, including a former tenant couple, in connection with the murder of a retired army officer and his wife. The couple, along with the woman's father, brother, and two hired accomplices, allegedly strangled the elderly couple in their home, stealing jewelry and cash.

title: Bags packed: Families refuse to take cured patients home from Nagpur mental hospital
content: Nagpur's Regional Mental Hospital witnesses a bittersweet reality. While one woman reunited with her family after treatment, many recovered patients remain stranded due to family rejection. Despite the hospital's efforts through counseling and legal notices, families refuse to take them back.

title: Meghalaya horror: Teen girl hacked to death in broad daylight
content: In Meghalaya's East Garo Hills district, a teenage schoolgirl was tragically killed in a machete attack in Samgong village near Williamnagar. The broad daylight assault, which occurred in full public view, has prompted a police manhunt for the assailant. Authorities are investigating the unknown motive behind the killing and have offered rewards for information leading to the accused's arrest.

title: 'Wanted honeymoon in Switzerland': Man slits govt official’s wife’s throat for gold
content: Driven by the desire to finance a lavish honeymoon in Europe, Kapil Kashyap, posing as an AC technician, brutally attacked the wife of a government official in Lucknow. He and his accomplice robbed her of gold jewelry. The police investigation led to their arrest, foiling Kapil's honeymoon plans and revealing his extensive criminal history and drug addiction.

title: IND vs ENG: Ex-England captain offers advice on the ONLY WAY India can level series
content: Michael Atherton suggests India consider a three-spinner attack, potentially including Kuldeep Yadav, for the crucial fourth Test at Old Trafford to exploit the spin-friendly conditions. This comes as Team India seeks to level the series after a narrow defeat at Lord's, with concerns about Jasprit Bumrah's workload also influencing team selection.

title: ‘Bollywood-style mansion, Rs 40 cr trail’: Conman caught hiding behind false wall
content: Roshan Saldanha, 43, was arrested in Mangaluru for allegedly running a nationwide fraud. He operated from a luxurious mansion with secret chambers. Saldanha is accused of cheating businessmen out of crores. He promised large loans and property investments. Victims paid advances but never received the promised funds. Police seized valuables and liquor from his residence.

title: 'You don’t need 22 robots': Nasser defends Siraj, sees shades of 2005 Ashes in Ind-Eng series
content: Former England captains Nasser Hussain and Michael Atherton draw parallels between the current India-England Test series and the iconic 2005 Ashes, highlighting the intense drama and closely contested matches. The series, currently led by England 2-1, is marked by on-field tension and individual rivalries, reminiscent of the Edgbaston Test two decades ago.

title: 'Night patrols, gunfire': Panic grips UP village as drones hover over homes
content: Panic has spread among residents of Chhajlat, Moradabad, due to repeated drone sightings at night, leading to community patrols and gunfire out of fear of burglar surveillance. Police are investigating the incidents, suspecting the drones are being operated by local youths to create panic. Residents are taking proactive measures to protect their properties amidst the ongoing investigation.

title: 'She's very talented': Melania praises Taylor Swift; defies Trump
content: In a surprising turn of events in the summer of 2025, Melania Trump publicly praised Taylor Swift's talent during a visit to a children's hospital, despite Donald Trump's critical remarks. Simultaneously, Swift and Travis Kelce were spotted enjoying a low-key lunch date in Ohio, showcasing their genuine connection away from the spotlight.

title: NBA trade rumors: Knicks delay Mikal Bridges extension amid $186m Bucks star trade buzz
content: The New York Knicks are strategically delaying Mikal Bridges' contract extension due to the uncertain future of Giannis Antetokounmpo with the Milwaukee Bucks. New York is closely monitoring Antetokounmpo's situation, as acquiring him would significantly elevate their championship prospects. Maintaining trade flexibility is crucial, even if it means postponing Bridges' well-deserved extension.

title: Lured on gay dating app, locked in shed, looted: B'luru man’s date turns into horror
content: In Bengaluru, a 31-year-old man was robbed after meeting someone from a gay dating app. Sahil was lured to a shed by Sufi, where he was assaulted and extorted. The culprits forced him to transfer money and call friends for more. Police arrested Sufiyan alias Sufi, a known rowdy-sheeter, and his associate.

title: ‘Named it after me’: Trump signs GENIUS Act; calls it ‘hell of an act'
content: President Trump signed the "Guiding and Establishing National Innovation for US Stablecoins Act," or GENIUS Act, into law, aiming to regulate payment stablecoins and foster financial innovation. Trump hailed the move as cementing American dominance in the digital currency space, acknowledging the crypto community's resilience. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent praised the law, emphasizing its role in securing the U.S.

title: Hockey Canada trial: Verdict nears for ex-players in sexual assault case
content: The Hockey Canada sexual assault trial has concluded. The case involves five former World Junior hockey players. They pleaded not guilty to charges from a 2018 incident in London, Ontario. The Crown argued the complainant did not consent. The defense questioned her credibility. Justice Maria Carroccia will deliver her verdict on July 24.

title: WCL 2025 Live Streaming: Where to Watch World Championship of Legends
content: Cricket enthusiasts are set for a nostalgic treat as the World Championship of Legends 2025 (WCL 2025) begins on July 18 in England. This T20 tournament features iconic retired international cricketers from six teams, including India, England, and Australia. Big names like Yuvraj Singh and Chris Gayle are expected to participate.

title: Op Sindoor: Pak’s Rahim Yar Khan base still shut; runway unusable till Aug 5
content: Indian missiles struck Pakistan's Rahim Yar Khan airbase during Operation Sindoor, rendering it non-operational for over two months. The strategic airbase, vital for Pakistan's southern air defense, sustained significant damage, as evidenced by repeated extensions of runway closure notices. Other airbases and a terror camp were also targeted, impacting Pakistan's military infrastructure.

title: Cricket | 'Slow over-rate is quality cricket': Hogg backs England after Lord's penalty
content: Brad Hogg defends slow over-rates in Test cricket, deeming them acceptable when matches are intense and display character. His comments follow England's ICC World Test Championship points deduction. Hogg suggests slow play can be strategic, especially in England, allowing bowlers to conserve energy and create tension, highlighting a pivotal moment in India's Lord's defeat.

title: Watch: Bumrah, Rahul join Lord’s elite as names added to Honours Board
content: Jasprit Bumrah and KL Rahul etched their names on the Lord's Honours Board following their stellar performances in the third Test against England. Bumrah's impressive 5/74 and Rahul's resilient century were pivotal in India's fight. Despite India's narrow defeat, their contributions were permanently recognised at the 'Home of Cricket', marking a proud moment amidst the loss.

title: WCL 2025: Captains, Squads, Schedule, Live Streaming of World Championship of Legends
content: Cricket legends are gearing up for the World Championship of Legends 2025 in England, from July 18 to August 2. Six teams representing India, Pakistan, South Africa, England, Australia, and West Indies will battle it out across four venues, with Edgbaston hosting key matches.

title: 'Dubo ke maarenge': Raj Thackeray counters BJP MP's 'patak ke maarenge' remark
content: MNS chief Raj Thackeray retaliated against BJP MP Nishikant Dubey's threatening remark, daring him to visit Mumbai, escalating the language debate in Maharashtra. Thackeray warned of retaliation in Mumbai's waters, responding to Dubey's defense that Mumbai isn't exclusively for Marathis.

title: Pahalgam attack: China condemns massacre; backs US terror tag on TRF
content: Following the US designation of The Resistance Front (TRF) as a Foreign Terrorist Organization after the Pahalgam massacre, China condemned the attack and advocated for increased regional counterterrorism cooperation. China's foreign ministry spokesperson Lin Jian voiced strong opposition to all forms of terrorism and supported US efforts to combat such acts, emphasizing the need for regional stability.

title: Colon cancer: How to lower your risk naturally with diet, exercise
content: Colorectal cancer is a significant global health concern, with rising cases, especially among younger individuals. Early screenings, starting at age 45, are crucial for prevention. Maintaining a healthy lifestyle through diet, exercise, and avoiding smoking and excessive alcohol consumption can significantly lower the risk. Combining these healthy habits offers the best protection.

title: Set up NIA courts or will give accused bail, SC warns govt; raps trial delays
content: The Supreme Court has expressed strong disapproval over delays in trials for NIA-investigated terrorism and heinous crime cases. It criticized the practice of designating existing courts for these cases, demanding the Union and Maharashtra governments establish new, exclusive special courts by September. Failure to comply may result in the courts considering bail for the accused due to trial delays.

title: MGNREGS mobile monitoring being fudged, govt tells states
content: The Ministry of Rural Development has directed states to improve monitoring of the National Mobile Monitoring System (NMMS) for MGNREGA, citing instances of misuse and manipulation. Discrepancies like irrelevant photo uploads and repeated worker photos raise concerns about accountability and potential financial irregularities. Congress has criticized the NMMS, demanding its withdrawal and reaffirmation of task-based payments.

title: Donald Trump mocks Brics; reiterates 10% tariff threat to protect US dollar dominance
content: Donald Trump dismissed the Brics group as fading and threatened tariffs on nations aligning with its policies, claiming credit for weakening their efforts to rival the US dollar. He signed the GENIUS Act into law, establishing a regulatory framework for payment stablecoins and preventing a US central bank digital currency. Brics denies being anti-American, despite Trump's claims.

title: Govt plans defence ‘takeover’ of Lakshadweep island
content: The Lakshadweep administration plans to acquire Bitra Island for defense purposes, sparking opposition from residents and MP Hamdullah Sayeed. A social impact assessment has been ordered by the revenue department, citing the island's strategic location and national security relevance.

title: In a first, 9 sentenced to life by court in Bengal for ‘digital arrest’ fraud
content: In a landmark verdict, a Kalyani court sentenced nine scammers to life imprisonment for extorting ₹1 crore from a Ranaghat resident through 'digital arrest'. The convicts, arrested across multiple states, were part of a gang that allegedly amassed ₹100 crore from 108 victims nationwide. The court agreed with the prosecution's argument, labeling such cybercrimes as 'economic terrorism'.

title: WCL 2025 squads: Full list of players, teams in World Championship of Legends
content: The World Championship of Legends (WCL) 2025, sanctioned by the ECB, will commence on July 18 in Birmingham. Six teams featuring cricket legends like Yuvraj Singh and AB de Villiers will compete in a T20 format. The tournament includes a league stage of 15 matches, followed by semifinals, with the final scheduled for August 2.

title: Our latest intel on MLB trade deadline rumors, Tucker's free agency and more
content: the baseball world gathered in Atlanta for the 2025 MLB draft , home run Derby and all-star game this week . our reporters were there talking to execs, coaches, agents, scouts, players and other team sources .

title: Sights and sounds from the second round of the 2025 Open Championship
content: the second round of the 153rd Open Championship has ended at Royal Portrush Golf Course in northern Ireland . Scottie Scheffler takes control of the proceedings with a 7-under performance Friday, bringing a 10-under into the weekend . pic.twitter.com/f33PdsVDmG Making his move .

title: Dear 'Diamond': Letters to Dustin Poirier on the eve of his final UFC fight
content: Dustin Poirier will make his final walk to the UFC Octagon against Max Holloway . the 36-year-old says he has decided to walk away to preserve his long-term health . poirier is considered one of the top lightweights in the world, ranked no. 5 in ESPN's divisional rankings .

title: If the College Football Playoff isn't broken, why fix it?
content: college football's opposition to an expanded, let alone expansive, playoff is dead and buried . the 81-year-old retired just this week after a second stint leading west Virginia University . plans to move from 12 participants to 16 were underway before last season's inaugural 12-teamer even took place .

title: Why Drake Maye can be a top-10 QB in 2025
content: in 11 starts from Week 6 to Week 17, Drake Maye threw for 2,254 yards, 15 touchdowns and 10 interceptions . that translated to an average of 16.0 fantasy points per game in those starts, which would have ranked just outside the top 12 quarterbacks over a full season . Maye has all the makings of a top-10 fantasy quarterback .

title: Joel Embiid sees you
content: Kendrick Perkins: Embiid feels pressured to play through injury showcases trust issues . he says he's leaning back on a couch that seemed spacious until he eased his long body onto it . his son, Arthur, peeks around corners from the hallway to see what we're up to .

title: Second half sees Ceddanne Rafaela at second base?
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . a mild 71 degrees with wind blowing slightly in could help keep a pair of potent lineups in check . the only game in jeopardy is the Washington Nationals hosting the San Diego Padres .

title: Trump vs WSJ explodes: US President sues Murdoch over Epstein story
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, providing a nuanced understanding of international affairs .

title: How to approach potential Rashee Rice suspension
content: fantasy football buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around the NFL . fantasy managers should brace for the likelihood Rice will miss a noticeable portion of the 2025 season . the odds of him serving a multigame suspension have significantly increased .

title: What we're hearing in the transfer window: Sancho, Rashford headed to Juve?
content: the transfer window is open across Europe, and business is starting to get done . sportsmail's reporters hear about possible deals every Friday until September . it's highly unlikely that Juventus will get both players, for a number of reasons .

title: Mumbai junior doctor attempts to end life citing harassment and discrimination, rushed to hospital
content: The doctor was being threatened with not being allowed to appear for her MD examinations by her teacher, who had constantly been harassing and discriminating her, her friends and batchmates wrote in the letter

title: Ministry of Railways directs zones to issue standardised ID cards to vendors to curb illegal vending
content: Railway commercial officials said unauthorised vendors have become a real menace in trains and at stations as they sell adulterated food products that can cause serious health issues for passengers

title: ED summons Google, Meta on July 21 in betting app case
content: According to sources, “Google and Meta platforms are promoting betting apps through advertisements and facilitating their reach to users”

title: Miscreants set 15-year-old girl on fire in Odisha, victim rushed to hospital
content: Three miscreants set the girl on fire in Bayabar village while she was going to her friend’s house, eyewitnesses said

title: Stretch of NH-10 between Sikkim, Bengal closed for traffic after landslip
content: Clearance activities are underway on the stretch following landslides at Birik Dara in Kalimpong district of West Bengal

title: Arrest of former Chhattisgarh CM Baghel’s son Chaitanya is tactics to crush people’s voice, says Priyanka Gandhi
content: “Former Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel was about to raise the issue of forests in the Assembly. To stop him, ED raided his house and arrested his son,” Priyanka Gandhi said in a post

title: Police constable, three family members booked for dowry harassment in Madurai after audio describing abuse goes viral
content: The police constable and his father, who is an Inspector of Police in Virudhunagar district, have been suspended

title: India, U.S. teams conclude fifth round of talks for proposed trade pact: Official
content: India is seeking the removal of this additional tariff (26%), and is also seeking the easing of tariffs on steel and aluminium (50%) and the auto (25%) sectors

title: Repairs on U.K. fighter jet grounded in Kerala completed, aircraft likely to fly out soon
content: Stealth aircraft manufactured by Lockheed Martin is expected to return to its base station in UK by early next week, subject to clearance from Ministry of External Affairs and Ministry of Defence

title: Bangladesh apprehends 34 Indian fishermen; high commission seeks their early return
content: The fishermen were apprehended on the intervening night of July 14 and 15 for venturing into Bangladesh’s territorial waters

title: Five held from Bengal's New Town over Patna hospital murder
content: The accused were apprehended from a housing complex in the satellite township of the metropolis following raids conducted jointly by the Patna Police and West Bengal STF in the early hours of Saturday

title: 4 killed, 2 injured as car crashes into concrete barrier on bridge, catches fire in Chhattisgarh
content: The official said that the car rammed into a concrete barrier on the side of a small bridge and caught fire

title: Free coaching for competitive examinations for 300 candidates at Davanagere
content: Sankalpa Free Coaching Centre has been set up jointly by Davangere district administration, Davangere University, S.S. Care Trust and IAS Baba Coaching Centre

title: Waive ₹13,300 cr. dues for CRPF deployment for anti-Maoist operations in Jharkhand: Soren to Shah
content: ‘If the State is forced to pay such a huge amount, it will adversely impact development schemes in Jharkhand, Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren said in a letter to Union Home Minister Amit Shah.

title: Supreme Court questions Maharashtra over exclusive MCOCA courts, sets deadline for 2017 corporator murder case
content: The bench, which asked the trial court to hear the case twice in a month, directed the defence counsels to cooperate with the trial court and not seek unnecessary adjournments

title: Woman dies after being pushed in front of oncoming train at Diva railway station; man arrested
content: "We are checking CCTV footage and speaking with eyewitnesses to piece together the full sequence of events," the official added

title: Thirteen police personnel injured in road accident in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar
content: They were all taken to Muzaffarnagar Medical College. Driver Munnilal had a fracture in his leg, while others got minor injuries

title: Uttar Pradesh records 18 deaths in 24 hours due to excessive rainfall
content: According to a statement, six people died in Chitrakoot district, while 3 each were killed in Mahoba, Banda and Moradabad. One each died in Ghazipur, Lalitpur and Gonda.

title: Fresh batch of over 6,000 pilgrims embark on Amarnath Yatra from Jammu
content: Annual Amarnath Yatra begins with tight security, separate convoys to Nunwan-Pahalgam and Baltal, attracting over 2.75 lakh pilgrims

title: ED files chargesheet against Uttarakhand Congress leader Harak Singh Rawat, wife in PMLA case
content: The accused named in the chargesheet include Harak Singh Rawat, his wife Deepti Rawat, his alleged associate Birendra Singh Kandari, Laxmi Singh Rana and the Smt. Poorna Devi Memorial Trust.

title: Mu. Ka. Muthu, Karunanidhi’s eldest son, is no more
content: Mr. Muthu was born to Karunanidhi’s first wife Padmavathi; he was an actor and singer, who was known to have styled himself after MGR

title: Jammu and Kashmir: Budha Amarnath Yatra to begin on July 28
content: Emphasising safety, the IGP stressed strict adherence to convoy timings and urged public awareness for travelling only with the official convoy

title: Heartbreaking scenes at Kochi airport as mother of Midhun who was electrocuted at school returns from Kuwait
content: Suja reportedly left for Kuwait as domestic help of an Arab family just four months ago to help her family recover from huge debts

title: 'Trump missile' fired 24th time, PM must make statement in Parliament: Congress
content: Trump stated that if India and Pakistan want a trade agreement with the U.S., they have to agree to an immediate ceasefire, Jairam Ramesh pointed out.

title: Pakistan claims terror network 'dismantled', denies LeT link to Pahalgam attack
content: Stating that the investigation into the Pahalgam attack is “still inconclusive,” Pakistan’s Foreign Office said, “any linkage with LeT, a defunct organisation banned in Pakistan, belies ground realities”.

title: Waqf Board, mutawallis in dilemma over new waqf portal
content: According to the Union government, the portal is intended to bring about transparency in administration and would also benefit Muslim women.

title: National Sports Governance Bill historic, will usher in new era for India, says Kiren Rijiju
content: The Bill seeks to create a framework for good governance in the National Sports Federations (NSFs) and the Indian Olympic Association (IOA)

title: Maharashtra excise department lapses caused revenue loss of several crore rupees: CAG
content: The cumulative effect of these lapses caused a massive revenue loss for the government, raising serious concerns about the functioning of the Excise Department, the CAG stated

title: Police searches underway at 10 locations in Kashmir
content: The CIK searches are being conducted in six locations in Ganderbal, two in Budgam, and one each in Pulwama and Srinagar

title: A.P. BJP president to begin State-wide tour from July 26
content: During his visits, Mr. Madhav would interact with the BJP cadre, apart from creating awareness on the development programmes being undertaken by the NDA government.

title: Girijana Aikya Vedika opposes inclusion of Boyas, Valmikis in ST list
content: The Boyas and Valmikis do not satisfy these criteria in the current socio-economic context of Andhra Pradesh, says Girijana Aikya Vedika State working president

title: NIA chargesheets top CPI (Maoist) leader for waging war against India
content: The supplementary chargesheet was filed before the NIA Special Court in Hyderabad, naming C.P. Moideen alias Girish, under various provisions of the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act, 1967, and the Indian Penal Code (IPC).

title: 'Years of huglomacy': Congress slams PM Modi over Trump's 'jets shot down' claims
content: the TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: He changed colours like chameleon: Shinde lambasts Uddhav Thackeray
content: The Shiv Sena leader revealed that Devendra Fadnavis made "40-50 calls" after the alliance of the undivided Shiv Sena and BJP retained its majority in the 2019 assembly elections, but Uddhav Thackeray did not respond

title: INDIA bloc parties to hold key online meet on July 19 to discuss prevailing political situation
content: The TMC, which was earlier said to be skipping the INDIA bloc meeting, however, said its national general secretary Abhishek Banerjee will attend the online meeting.

title: Those who label Kanwariyas as miscreants also alienated tribal communities, says U.P. CM Yogi
content: Adityanath cautioned people from anti-social elements who attempt to fuel caste and communal tensions.

title: Empower women, free them from regressive traditions: RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat
content: Mohan Bhagwat said that women form the most vital part of society and possess unique qualities that not only shape the present but also nurture future generations.

title: Former West Bengal BJP President Dilip Ghosh says party did not invite him to PM rally, gives it a miss
content: This is the third time in the recent past where Dilip Ghosh has stayed absent in a major BJP event hosting a national leader

title: Gujarat’s collapsing bridges: Falling through the cracks
content: Earlier this month, 20 people were killed in Gujarat when a segment of the Mujpur-Ghambira bridge fell into the swollen Mahisagar river below. Residents say they had flagged concerns about the safety of the structure, but claim that the authorities either ignored them or took no action despite admitting that there were risks. Abhinay Deshpande reports on the tragedy in a State where at least six bridges have collapsed in the last four years

title: Polavaram Left Main Canal works will be completed this year, says A.P. Minister
content: The NDA government is committed to completing Polavaram Project by December 2027, says Nimmala Rama Naidu

title: Not against Hindi, but against forced imposition: Raj Thackeray
content: Referring to Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis’ statement that Hindi would be taught in schools at any cost, the MNS chief says everyone living in Maharashtra must learn Marathi

title: Farooq Abdullah presses for restoration of Statehood to J&K
content: Restoration of full Statehood is vital to uphold the dignity, identity, and autonomy of the region, says NC president

title: Madras High Court bids adieu to Chief Justice K.R. Shriram
content: He pays rich encomiums to his colleagues in the Bench, the Madras Bar and the staff of the High Court for their support during his tenure

title: NGT directs Karnataka govt. to act on Thenpennai river pollution, seeks action plan within a month
content: The bench expressed serious concern over the river’s condition, particularly in the stretch flowing from Karnataka into Tamil Nadu, where foaming, blackened water, and foul odour have been reported

title: Proper records help Kozhikode, Payyoli climb ranks in national cleanliness survey
content: The Kozhikode Corporation rose from 3,367 in 2023 to 70 this year, while Payyoli jumped from 3,707 to 596

title: How public sector incubator AIC is helping startups turn ideas into impact in Hyderabad
content: From zero-calorie sweets to lab-grown meat, biotech startups at the Atal Incubation Centre in Hyderabad are working on futuristic ideas; the centre, backed by CSIR-CCMB, provides lab access, expert mentoring and funding support to help young scientists turn research into real-world solutions

title: HMT land denotification: Suspended IFoS officer offers apology, Minister orders revocation of suspension
content: MoEFF is learnt to have communicated that the official’s suspension cannot be considered at this stage due to a ‘technical reason’

title: Chaitanya Baghel actively linked to proceeds of crime in liquor case: ED tells court
content: Probe agency tells PMLA court that Laxmi Narayan Bansal, another co-accused, had admitted that he handled more than ₹1,000 crore cash originating out of the liquor scam in association with Mr. Chaitanya Baghel, which are proceeds of crime

title: India does not subscribe to any unilateral measures, government says on EU sanctions
content: The European Union has announced a new package of sanctions aimed at Russia over its war against Ukraine. It also named Gujarat-based Nayara Energy’s Vadinar Refinery in which Russian energy firm Rosneft has a major stake.

title: Prashant Kishor leaves rally in a huff in Bihar, party says he suffered injury
content: According to a leader of the Jan Suraaj party, Mr. Kishor drove back to his Patna residence after receiving first aid locally.

title: BMTC conductor crashes e-bus into makeshift hotel in Peenya, killing 25-year-old woman, injuring four
content: According to the police, the bus (KA 51 AK 4170) operates between Majestic and Peenya Industrial Area. Around 8.15 a.m. on Friday, the bus arrived at Peenya stand.

title: Madras HC refuses to quash prosecution initiated by ECI against K.C. Veeramani for filing false affidavit
content: Justice P. Velmurugan dismisses the quash petition after ECI says, the former Minister had suppressed properties acquired abroad and also given false PAN numbers in his election affidavit

title: Six Maoists killed in encounter with security forces in Chhattisgarh’s Narayanpur
content: A gunfight broke out in the afternoon in the forest of Abujhmad region when joint teams of security forces were out on an operation, says Inspector General of Police (Bastar Range) P. Sundarraj

title: The Resistance Front was floated to deflect international sanctions against Pakistan: security officials
content: The Resistance Front has carried out terror attacks in Jammu & Kashmir’s Keran, Handwara, Sopore, Shopian, Anantnag, and Reasi with the latest one in Baisaran meadows of Pahalgam on April 22

title: INDIA bloc had ‘limited success’ due to ideological inconsistency, says CPI
content: Ahead of the party’s 25th Congress general secretary D. Raja released the draft political resolution

title: Narendra Modi’s Bihar visit was an empty bundle: Manoj Kumar Jha
content: Without naming anyone, Mr. Jha alleged that the government in Bihar is running from Delhi Durbar and those who were supposed to run Bihar are not even able to run their own house.

title: 94.68% of Bihar voters covered in electoral roll revision drive, says Election Commission
content: With just 7 days left for collection of forms, the ECI has begun sharing the list of forms that could not be collected with political parties

title: Six migrant workers from Bengal arrested in Punjab under cow slaughter law
content: Detentions come amid wider concerns over treatment of West Bengal migrants across States; Welfare Board steps in for legal aid

title: Nine get life imprisonment in Bengal for ‘digital arrest’ fraud
content: Victim lost ₹1 crore and was digitally arrested for almost seven days; convicts are part of a gang which defrauded over ₹100 crore from 108 people across India

title: IPS officer tells Karnataka High Court that ‘someone else’, not police, has to be held accountable for Bengaluru stampede
content: It was pointed out to the court that the government has taken a ‘contradictory stand’ as it has, on the one hand, justified the action of suspending senior police officers, and on the other hand, it has defended the safety and security measures taken by police

title: Maharashtra clears proposal to rename Islampur as Ishwarpur
content: The renaming of Islampur to Ishwarpur is the latest in a series of name changes undertaken by the Maharashtra government; in recent years, the State has renamed Aurangabad to Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar and Osmanabad to Dharashiv, with the Centre’s approval

title: RSS-affiliated farmers’ body calls for cancellation of permission to test GM maize at Punjab Agricultural University
content: Raising serious objections to the plan, a delegation headed by BKS Punjab chief Ravinder Singh Dhillon submitted a memorandum to the Vice Chancellor of Punjab Agricultural University

title: Bihar Cabinet gives nod to provide 125 units of free electricity to 1.67 crore power consumers
content: No fixed charge or other charges to be levied on those consuming up to 125 units; consumers using above 125 units will continue to get subsidised rate

title: BMRCL employees’ union opposes plan to outsource metro train operators
content: However, a senior BMRCL official clarified that the outsourcing decision has been taken primarily to address the current shortage of trained staff.

title: ‘Supreme Court of Karnataka’: To prove misuse, Centre opens fake account on X
content: Solicitor-General shows verified X handle to High Court; X Corp. calls move improper, says account now suspended
